byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Obama administration is relying on Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence agency to help broker a peace deal with the Haqqani terrorist network just months after accusing the same agency of secretly supporting the network; the strategy is the latest effort at brokering a deal before the last of 33,000 American surge troops prepare to pull out of Afghanistan.
snippet: The United States is relying on Pakistan’s Inter-Services Intelligence to help broker a peace deal in Afghanistan with the same militants that the agency has been accused of supporting.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The United States is relying on Pakistan’s Inter-Services Intelligence to help broker a peace deal in Afghanistan with the same militants that the agency has been accused of supporting.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks Aid From Pakistan in Peace Effort
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks Aid From Pakistan In Peace Effort
headline.seo: Pakistan Spy Agency’s Help Sought for Afghan Talks
